intro: Staurochilus agusanensis, commonly known as the Agusan star orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species found exclusively in the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or rocks in montane forests. Its floral structure includes specialized sepals and petals that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Staurochilus agusanensis is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
